alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 01 at 12:56PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Maggie Creek Near Carlin affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Maggie Creek...including Carlin...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Maggie Creek Near Carlin. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 4.5 feet, Monitoring stage occurs. No flooding occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM PDT Monday, May 1 the stage was 4.4 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 4.5 feet. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon by 130 PM PDT.
